item.title: Fine Arts Panel, Remade by Trump, Indicates Support for His Ballroom Plan
item.description: A rendering of the proposed White House ballroom in the Oval Office last month. ]]>

item.title: Alfred McLaren, 93, Dies; Submariner Led Secret Cold War Missions
item.description:
He participated in the first baseball game at the North Pole. Later, he became an expert in the impact of climate change on Arctic ice sheets.

]]>

item.title: Dallas County Exonerates Black Man Who Was Executed in 1956
item.description:
An all-white jury convicted Tommy Lee Walker of rape and murder, relying on inadmissible evidence and a coerced confession that he immediately recanted, county officials said.

]]>

item.title: White House Posts Altered Photo Showing Arrested Minnesota Protester Crying
item.description: Nekima Levy Armstrong after speaking at an anti-ICE rally in St. Paul, Minn., on Monday. The Justice Department said on Thursday morning that it had taken her into custody, accusing her of helping to interrupt a church service in St. Paul. ]]>

item.title: D.H.S. Cited Foreign Students’ Writings and Protests Before Their Arrests
item.description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio approved the revocation of visas for five international students last year. ]]>

item.title: Trump Withdraws Carney’s Invitation for Canada to Join His ‘Board of Peace’
item.description:
The president appeared to be lashing out in response to stark, high-profile remarks by Prime Minister Mark Carney of Canada that rejected Mr. Trump’s efforts to dismantle the international order.

]]>

item.title: Jasmine Crockett and James Talarico Face Off in a Texas Senate Primary Campaign
item.description:
Two of the Democrats’ rising stars, Jasmine Crockett and James Talarico, are seeing if a red state should be won courting disaffected Republicans or focusing on the party’s base.

]]>

item.title: The Whipple Building Is at the Center of Minnesota’s Immigration Drama

item.title: Increased Scrutiny Leads to an Improved Organ Transplant System
item.description: A medical worker holding a recovered kidney. ]]>

item.title: Voters Are Split on Deportations but Disapprove of ICE, Poll Finds
item.description:
While roughly half of voters support President Trump’s handling of the border between the United States and Mexico, a sizable majority says that ICE’s tactics have “gone too far.”

]]>

item.title: Hundreds of Minnesota Businesses on Strike in Protest Against ICE
item.description:
After protesters called for a pause on economic activity and work to strike against the federal immigration crackdown, many business owners kept their doors shut on Friday.

]]>

item.title: Portland, Maine, Feels Like a Small Town — And ICE Isn’t Welcome
item.description: The federal immigration offensive began in Maine this week, the latest in a series of similar campaigns in cities across the country. ]]>

item.title: Trump Says He Bruised His Hand on a Table
item.description:
The president also said he was prone to bruising because of the high dose of aspirin he has taken daily for three decades.

]]>

item.title: Democrats Seek Maxwell Prison Visit, Citing Preferential Treatment
item.description: Ghislaine Maxwell’s time at the federal prison camp in Bryan, Texas, has been a focus of significant backlash since she was relocated there last summer. ]]>

item.title: 5 Arrested in Shooting of Indiana Judge Steven Meyer and His Wife
item.description: Steven Meyer, a judge of the Tippecanoe County Superior Court, and his wife, Kimberly, were shot on Sunday at their home in Lafayette, Ind. ]]>

item.title: A Republican Vaccine Defender Fights to Hang On
item.description: Senator Bill Cassidy’s re-election bid was upended last week President Trump endorsed a challenger, imperiling the senator’s already-shaky standing with Republicans back home. ]]>

item.title: Labor Secretary’s Security Guard Placed on Leave
item.description: Allegations about the conduct of Labor Secretary Lori Chavez-DeRemer are part of broader dissatisfaction and turmoil during her tenure, current and former employees of the department said. ]]>

item.title: At March for Life, Some Abortion Opponents Want More From Trump
item.description: Preparations for the annual March for Life rally on the National Mall. President Trump was expected to deliver remarks via recorded message. ]]>

item.title: Defending His Absence in House, Hunt Celebrates Casting a Vote
item.description: Representative Wesley Hunt, Republican of Texas, has missed 95 percent of roll call votes since Dec. 18. ]]>

item.title: Bovino Says ICE and Border Patrol Agents Are ‘Experts in Dealing With Children’
item.description: The detention of Liam on Tuesday provoked a storm of public criticism. The child’s school district and the federal government have given conflicting accounts of his detention. ]]>

item.title: Couple Receive $200,000 Settlement After ‘Pungent’ Indian Food Complaint
item.description:
The University of Colorado, Boulder, denied liability in the civil rights lawsuit, which the couple filed after a comment about a dish that one of them was heating in an office microwave.
